meanings.definition: Having a strong or extreme effect
meanings.sent1: The sun's intense heat made the sand very hot.
meanings.sent2: She had an intense desire to succeed in her studies.
meanings.sent3: The intense competition for the last piece of cake was amusing.
meanings.sent4: His intense focus on the task at hand was like a laser beam.
meanings.sent5: The intense colors of the sunset painted the sky in a breathtaking display.

meanings.sent1: Her intense love for animals led her to volunteer at the shelter.
meanings.sent2: He had an intense dislike for spicy food.
meanings.sent3: The intense argument over which movie to watch was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The intense passion in her eyes was like a burning flame.
meanings.sent5: The intense joy on his face when he won the game was contagious.

meanings.sent1: The storm caused intense damage to the houses in the area.
meanings.sent2: The pain in his leg was so intense that he couldn't walk.
meanings.sent3: The intense punishment for being late was amusingly unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The intense pressure at work felt like a weight on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The intense fear in her eyes was palpable as she entered the haunted house.
